text: Spain continues to see a dramatic rise
in the number of deaths recording its
biggest daily death toll yet through
seven hundred and thirty-eight people
have died in the last 24 hours and total
deaths in Spain 3400 are now greater
than in mainland China where the
outbreak originated the government in
Madrid is now looking to the EU for help
with protective equipment for its
medical workers our Europe correspondent
Gavin Lee says the Catalonia region now
also has a rising number of infections
there are two records not just the
highest single number of deaths in 24
hours but also the highest number of
cases in 24 hours seven thousand nine
hundred and seventy-three and that gives
a sense of the speed of the spread the
sharpness of this spread across the
country but Madrid we know where there's
two-thirds of those deaths two-thirds of
three and a half thousand deaths have
happened but also the Catalonia region
in the East a big spread there huge
concern of of concentrated areas of
Spain where the authorities simply
cannot cope because the mortuaries the
morgues in Madrid are full to capacity
soldiers have come in they've opened up
an ice rink where they're bringing
bodies is a temporary morgue there they
it was reported this morning in Spanish
state newspapers and say television that
they had asked NATO for official help
NATO we understand actually they cannot
provide the sort of medical equipment
that spain needs what we're talking
about is one and a half million face
masks half a million respirators half a
million fast emergency testing kits
hundreds of ventilators and now this
will have to go to EU countries now's
where possibly China to see what comes
back and the EU they're going through a
procurement programme at the moment it's
in it's early stages there are reports
that at the moment it looks like
countries combined could only provide
around ten percent of what's needed
around the the EU so that's something
that may take some time but worrying for
Spain today going across to Italy
whether the figure is still you know the
highest anywhere in terms of the death
toll in the world seventy thousand cases
7,000 deaths Giuseppe Conti the Prime
Minister they're saying that they will
look to increase now the the penalties
of people violating the strict
lockdown they're up to 4000 euros and if
you are in quarantine and you therefore
breach that quarantine you're looking at
a possible five year jail sentence so
that's the severity that is till he's
taking it now
Gavin Lee
